page.title: 13Arlington Reservoir:wildlife
page.content: The Reservoir and its surroundings are a nature reserve. It is a Site of Special Scientific Interest and also a popular picnic area, with car park and toilets, footpaths and bridleway. There is a separate bird breeding sanctuary with no public access. Widgeon winter here - 173 species of bird have been sighted including osprey, Hooper & Bewick swans, and rare grasshopper warbler. Animals - fox, rabbit, stoat, weasel, adders; occasionally wild mink. Many moths & butterflies including rare five spot brown burnet, clouded yellow. Trees - silver birch, oak, dogwood, wild cherry, willow, ash, pine, fir, blackthorn & double gorse. Wild flowers & grasses of many kinds flourish here.
